meanings.definition: To mark off or define boundaries
meanings.sent1: She carefully metes out the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor metes the land to separate the properties.
meanings.sent3: The teacher metes out homework assignments with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The judge metes justice to those who break the law.
meanings.sent5: The ruler metes the paper before cutting it.

meanings.sent1: The fence serves as a metes for the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The river acts as a natural metes between the two towns.
meanings.sent3: The metes of the park are where the grass ends and the sidewalk begins.
meanings.sent4: The metes of the contract are clearly defined in the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The metes of the game are set by the rules.
